sentences.en: Again and again to leave and escape will only cheapen yourself.
sentences.cn: 一次次的离开和逃避只会让自己变得廉价.

sentences.en: In no case can we cheapen the quality of products.
sentences.cn: 在任何情况下我们都不能降低产品质量.

sentences.en: It's not in Jose's interest to do everything because it would cheapen the situation.
sentences.cn: 何塞的兴趣不在于接下所有广告,因为这会与他的身价不符.

sentences.en: Love is a word cheapened by overuse.
sentences.cn: 爱情这个词因滥用而变得廉价了。

sentences.en: Provide extremely in market chase after go up and kill cheapen when the value, particularly useful.
sentences.cn: 在市况极具追涨和杀跌价值时, 非凡有用.

sentences.en: The good harvest that year cheapened the costs of some raw materials.
sentences.cn: 那年的好收成使一些原材料的成本有所降低。

sentences.en: The price is changeable. Sometimes cheapen the goods to attract customers. They may be rather cheap.
sentences.cn: 价格多变, 有时连锁店对货物降价以吸引顾客, 可能很便宜.

sentences.en: We cheapen commodities at the moment.
sentences.cn: 目前我们只好使商品削价.

sentences.en: When America boycotted the Moscow Olympics it cheapened the medals won.
sentences.cn: 当美国抵制莫斯科奥运会时，所获奖牌的价值降低了。

sentences.en: You just can't afford to let her hang - ups cheapen our relationship.
sentences.cn: 你也不应该毫不容情地让她成为阻止我们相好的障碍.

trans.tran_en: to become or make something become lower in price or value

trans.tran_cn: 减价，降低（自己[某事物]）的身价，贬低
